# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/pygments/styles/__init__.py
@source-hash: 54c8f707b17a29fd
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:57:27Z

## Purpose
Style management module for Pygments syntax highlighting. Provides discovery, loading, and access to built-in and plugin-based color schemes/styles used for code highlighting.

## Key Components

### Global Mappings
- `STYLE_MAP` (L18): **Deprecated** dictionary mapping style names to `'submodule::classname'` format strings for built-in styles
- `_STYLE_NAME_TO_MODULE_MAP` (L21): Internal reverse mapping `{style_name: (module_path, class_name)}` optimized for efficient lookups in `get_style_by_name`

### Core Functions
- `get_style_by_name(name)` (L24-53): Primary style loader function
  - First checks built-in styles via `_STYLE_NAME_TO_MODULE_MAP` 
  - Falls back to plugin styles via `find_plugin_styles()`
  - Final fallback attempts direct module import from `pygments.styles.{name}`
  - Returns style class, raises `ClassNotFound` if not found
  
- `get_all_styles()` (L56-61): Generator yielding all available style names from both built-in (`STYLES.values()`) and plugin sources

## Dependencies
- `pip._vendor.pygments.plugin.find_plugin_styles`: Plugin style discovery
- `pip._vendor.pygments.util.ClassNotFound`: Exception for missing styles
- `pip._vendor.pygments.styles._mapping.STYLES`: Master style registry from separate mapping module

## Architecture Notes
- Uses lazy loading pattern - styles only imported when requested
- Three-tier lookup strategy: built-in → plugin → direct import
- Built-in styles referenced via external `STYLES` registry rather than hardcoded
- Maintains backward compatibility with deprecated `STYLE_MAP` format
- Error handling provides context about whether style should be built-in vs. plugin
